title: Augusta County: Tony Pastor to Annie Harris, October 19, 1861
summary: Pastor describes falling back and fortifying in a new, advantageous position in the face of news of a very large army of Yankees approaching. He reports rumors of Yankees pouring into Kentucky and predicts a major battle there, too. Many of the men seem to be sick. At the end of the letter, Pastor has just received orders to strike his tent and prepare to march away.
keywords: Camp Life, Death/Casualties, Military Strategy, Patriotism, Troop Movement, American Civil War
